body: @basvanbeek @adriancole I would like to contribute username/password property file refreshing based on the sketch @adriancole share with us.
@hanahmily sweet. feel free to drop by https://gitter.im/openzipkin/zipkin with questions or https://line-armeria.slack.com/ if about the ES client interceptor hooks
@hanahmily Haha, you are having fun here. Same feature in different projects :)
@hanahmily did a first cursory pass, i'll have a more in-depth look tomorrow. Hope you find the feedback useful.
@jorgheymans Thanks for your review. I have fixed them. Please check out them again. Thanks a lot.
@adriancole @jorgheymans Would you please re-run ci? ITZipkinServerSsl seems stuck, but I can't reproduce it locally.
@hanahmily don't worry about CI, it's known to be flaky sometimes. For me your branch is building fine locally without errors.
a relic of past times, closing this one.
With Lens being the new default UI now we can consider zipkin-ui renovation complete. Separate issues should be directly logged against Lens.
This issue refers to the "classic" zipkin UI which is no longer maintained (https://github.com/openzipkin-attic/zipkin-classic), please reopen against Lens if still applicable.
question answered, thanks.
if still relevant, dupes #1047
https://zipkin.io/zipkin/ is correct as the README says.
@tacigar it looks like this in place, can the issue be closed ?
Yup
Tried, but no.
please drop by in the gitter channel for questions https://gitter.im/openzipkin/zipkin
Was resolved, in any case zipkin-classic is no longer maintained.
question answered, please use https://gitter.im/openzipkin/zipkin for follow questions.

In Lens, in-flight spans are shown correctly (no Nan) but there is no visual indication either that it's in-flight. A subtle hint or mouse-over that the request is in-flight is probably still useful. 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/193792/78376984-556b5900-75cf-11ea-9248-d2c2515f8e4f.png)
zipkin-classic is no longer maintained, i verified that the linked trace displays correctly in Lens.
zipkin-ui module was deleted.
agree to rollback guava. I add a simple rate-limit impl we can use if armeria's log limiter isnt in reach.

one way around having to do poll events, which I know is ugly code, is to integrate somehow directly with the armeria internal health checker which exists already. When that turns bad for reason of authorization (401 maybe?) then immediately do a refresh attempt. We'd also want to rate limit the refresh on authorization as if a refresh attempt doesn't resolve the credentials it could spin.. however, this part could be a tighter interval vs 5s. cc @anuraaga
by "immediately do a refresh attempt" I don't necessarily mean do that on the client health check thread which might be a netty event loop. it should be done on a blocking thread

> Is this to reduce logging if a user sets a really small refresh interval? It seems like overkill especially since most will be in the seconds, how about just logging without the limit?

@anuraaga looking back, I agree with this, now that the unit is seconds. But let's not let the unit become less than seconds. I think if we accept duration, we'll get back into that.
Question answered, thanks !
Lens (the new UI) is less presumptive, and zipkin-classic is no longer maintained so we can close this.
zipkin-classic (https://github.com/openzipkin-attic/zipkin-classic) is no longer maintained, Lens (the new UI) has its own I18N system added in #2487.
Thanks @hanahmily , this looks good to be merged !
Question answered, thanks !
Question seems answered, and no more feedback received since. If you still have issues with broker connectivity please open a separate issue.
This one slipped through the maze it seems, did you ever find a resolution to this ?
question answered, mysql is not for high volume sites.

That was almost 3 years ago - have since moved on from that project.  No
idea if this was ever fixed.

Ok thanks for the quick feedback ! 

I'll close this issue, both zipkin and sleuth have evolved quite a bit since then and nobody seemed to have struggled with the same problem.
Zipkin uses spring-boot configuration mechanisms nowadays, i think this issue can be closed.
Zipkin exposes its metrics via `/prometheus` endpoint now.
The instructions for building now work on windows as well : https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin#running-the-server-from-source
The instructions for building now work on windows as well : https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin#running-the-server-from-source
The switch to JOOQ has since long happened.
While documentation improvement is always ongoing, we should use more specific issues to track those places where improvement is needed.
Gradle huh ?
@anuraaga does Armeria expose this metric already ?
I think this is in? @anuraaga @tacigar ?
@jorgheymans Glade to hear that. and @jorgheymans @adriancole and @anuraaga Thank you for help with the PR review.

Yeah you can see the screenshot in this PR with a Download JSON button - https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/pull/2985

We have had some discussion about whether we should move that next to the upload JSON button, which may be causing confusion here. But since the upload JSON button is valid anywhere, hence in a global layout, and the download JSON is only valid in the context of a trace, hence in the trace page layout, they're in different locations. I can think of pros/cons of both, and not being a UX person not sure if I can decide
Yup - confirmed we have `elasticsearch_active_requests` in prometheus now

SEARCH_ENABLED controls the trace query screen (or used to ;P)
DEPENDENCIES_ENABLED?

PS I'm cool with this. ES_ENSURE_TEMPLATES ok?
agree. usually something like this is debug level

+1 to the flag that disables this. Side issue: when there is no data I
would add a text saying: did you run the aggregation job? and a link to it.

Indeed, added here https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/commit/08cee5023bf6e24c277bce85839ad1c043230f63 and thus available from zipkin-server 2.19.3 onwards
... and so user `zipkinci` was born
Both scala and gradle are no longer used in zipkin, Intellij imports the maven project just fine now.
I'll wager that if span timestamps had been incorrect back then, it would have been fixed long since.

The [test](https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/blob/946b96ce18e9b5cdc31bb447bcf09dc1df383f0f/zipkin-tests/src/main/java/zipkin2/storage/ITDependencies.java#L230) has evolved long since and works correctly.
This seems to be referring to zipkin v2 data model which has been released.
Integration tests located here : https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/tree/master/zipkin-server/src/it  . We can open more specific issues if anything is lacking there.
@jcchavezs @basvanbeek you're both go-savvy, is this issue still relevant ?
This issue refers to zipkin-classic which is no longer maintained and replaced by Lens. If the duration search component is not satisfactory there please open a new issue.
Go library has changed a lot (notably thrift is not support anymore) and also this issue is from 2014 so maybe it is not relevant anymore.
@zhanghba as said please drop by on Gitter thanks.
Things were re-logo'd, thanks !
Migration reverted thanks.

Effort was completed to create a "slim" version which currently weighs in at about half the size of the 'classic' zipkin server , and further additions of any new dependencies are heavily scrutinized first.

Did we relogoed for attic and contrib too?

Verified on latest version, there are no more `method="UNKNOWN"` metrics so presumably this has been fixed in Armeria since.

Current zipkin/Lens has no issues with abovementioned trace so i'll go ahead and close. I have not seen any other skew bugs being reported recently, seems a thing of the past.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/193792/78931607-7b4c9e00-7aa6-11ea-9623-399c90482701.png)

Version check is failing fast now: https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/blob/28c98c4cbad33db187f6606754359376ebe60406/zipkin-storage/elasticsearch/src/main/java/zipkin2/elasticsearch/VersionSpecificTemplates.java#L191
IIRC circleci was used for a while, then it went back to Travis and has been for a while now.
No feedback after 18 months, if you want us to fix it please follow up on the bug report. If this is still an issue against the latest version open a new issue.
I guess not then, closing.

Did we relogoed for attic and contrib too?
>
we could use the old logo for attic, for the sake of irony :)

Noting that for ES we have many metrics (piggybacking off Armeria), for Cassandra there does not seem to be any metrics reported indeed. 

The Cassandra driver does come with support for Dropwizard style metrics, so an exporter from this to prometheus "seems" trivial via https://github.com/prometheus/client_java/tree/master/simpleclient_dropwizard .

For cassandra, see also

* https://github.com/micrometer-metrics/micrometer/issues/1397
* also we're way overdue in upgrading to driver 4.. there's an issue somewhere. here's a related one from boot https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/issues/18621
Lens is now the default UI.
The transition phase is over, Lens is now the default UI. The previous 'classic' UI is no longer packaged with the server, no more button to revert back to the old UI.
This issue references zipkin-classic which is no longer maintained. Note that a similar issue #3058  exists in Lens, the new UI

Lens has you covered :+1: 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/193792/79001797-73950400-7b4f-11ea-98ec-0070a85435b3.png)

As of v2.20 of Zipkin, Lens now explicitly supports reverse proxy configurations (https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/pull/2987), documentation can be found [here](https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/tree/master/zipkin-lens#running-behind-a-reverse-proxy)
As we backed out of the apache.org migration, this is no longer relevant.

okay, closing then. If this somehow is still relevant it can be reopened with more details against the current codebase.

[Cassandra storage configuration](https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/tree/master/zipkin-server#cassandra-storage) has this option now:

```
* `CASSANDRA_USERNAME` and `CASSANDRA_PASSWORD`: Cassandra authentication. Will throw an exception on startup if authentication fails. No default
```
Question was answered satisfactorily it seems, closing !

Given that [getAvailableWithoutFetching](https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/blob/14de677f4a5e987a4a1953ec5d84d6273db3628e/zipkin-storage/cassandra/src/main/java/zipkin2/storage/cassandra/internal/call/AccumulateAllResults.java#L75) has been in place since then, we can close this suggestion. It has been answered also in the linked PR, therefor closing.

`yarn` has not happened since then, if specific issues are created against the current build system that `yarn` could solve, a switch may still happen but preferrably referencing those specific issues. 

Until then, `npm` seems to be satisfactory for developing Lens.
I can try to fix this myself if any input @jorgheymans @adriancole @anuraaga (It is also fine to say it is irrelevant)
what you mention sounds fine, though I would order it so that the tags are in the same place. thanks! cc @tacigar
I would guess it is ok :) If there's some nuanced reason it isn't we can re-open. Thanks @jorgheymans
